dt: {bc}a basket often carried on the back of an animal or the shoulders of a person
{bc}one of a pair of packs or baskets hung over the rear wheel of a vehicle (such as a bicycle)
{bc}one of a pair of hoops formerly used to expand women's skirts at the sides
{bc}an overskirt draped at the sides of a skirt for an effect of fullness

et: Middle English {it}panier{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}paner, panier{/it}, from Latin {it}panarium{/it}, from {it}panis{/it} bread {ma}{mat|food|}{/ma}
shortdef: a basket often carried on the back of an animal or the shoulders of a person
one of a pair of packs or baskets hung over the rear wheel of a vehicle (such as a bicycle)
